description: New Year's Day is the first day of the calendar year and is celebrated each January 1st
name: New Year's Day

description: Always celebrated on 26 January
name: Australia Day

description: Held on the second Monday of March each year in Canberra to celebrate the naming ceremony of Australia's capital which took place on 12 March 1913.
name: Canberra Day

description: Easter is celebrated with Good Friday and Easter Monday creating a 4 day long weekend.
name: Good Friday

description: Easter Saturday is between Good Friday and Easter Sunday in Australia.
name: Easter Saturday

description: Public Holiday as part of Easter.
name: Easter Sunday

description: Public Holiday as part of Easter.
name: Easter Monday

description: Celebrated on the 25 April each year.
name: Anzac Day

description: Takes place on the first Monday on or after 27 May each year the anniversary of the 1967 referendum
name: Reconciliation Day

description: Celebrated on second Monday in June except in Western Australia and Queensland.
name: Queen's Birthday

description: Always on a Monday creating a long weekend. It celebrates the eight-hour working day a victory for workers in the mid-late 19th century.
name: Labour Day

description: Christmas Day is an annual holiday which celebrates the birth of Jesus Christ over 2000 years ago.
name: Christmas Day

description: Boxing Day occurs the day after Christmas. Sydney-to-Hobart yacht race and Boxing Day Test Match (Cricket) start on this day.
name: Boxing Day

description: As 25 December (Christmas Day) falls on a Saturday in 2021, there is an additional public holiday on the Monday.
name: Christmas (additional day)

description: As 26 December (Boxing Day) falls on a Sunday in 2021, there is an additional public holiday on the Tuesday.
name: Boxing Day (additional day)
